title.rendered: An Ultimate Guide on Permanent Eyeliner

content.rendered:
If you’re considering permanent eyeliner, you’re likely looking for a way to streamline your beauty routine. And you’re definitely not alone. Permanent eyeliner is one of the most popular cosmetic procedures in the world. It’s no wonder it offers a host of benefits that other makeup can’t beat.

Every day, thousands of people decide to get this popular beauty treatment. Permanent eyeliner can enhance your appearance and give you a more youthful look. But before you decide to go ahead and get the procedure done, there are some things you should know.

And this guide will tell you everything you need to know about permanent eyeliner, from the benefits to the aftercare and everything in between.

What Is Permanent Eyeliner?

Permanent eyeliner, also called semi-permanent makeup, is a cosmetic tattooing procedure. It’s used to create the look of fuller, darker eyelashes and to define the shape of the eye.

The procedure, also known as an eyeliner tattoo, may be done in various ways, including big strong wings, light lash enhancements, or smoky looks in various hues.

Different Styles of Permanent Eyeliner

Permanent eyeliner comes in a variety of styles to suit every taste. The most popular styles are:

  • Winged liner: Your outer corners have a wing or flick that extends out above the crease of your lids.

  • Feline liner: Mimic the cat eye look.

  • Shaded/Smokey liner: a soft, smokey line that diffuses out from the lash line like a smudged pencil.

  • Lash Enhancement: a light blend of subtle definition through the lash line.

  • Classic Eyeliner: the most popular style of eyeliner. Starts with the first lash inside the corner to the last lash outside of the eye in an even line. Clients choose between thin, medium, and thick eyeliner.

When discussing your desired eyeliner style with a permanent makeup artist, don’t hesitate to bring visual aids, like photos from magazines or Pinterest. This will help them understand your vision and give you the best results possible.

How Permanent Eyeliner Can Benefit You?

Imagine never worrying about your makeup smudging or rubbing off throughout the day. Imagine waking up every morning with perfectly applied eyeliner – no muss, no fuss. Sounds pretty great, right? Well, that’s exactly what you can expect when you get permanent eyeliner. There are many different benefits to permanent eyeliner:

Freedom from the Hassle of Applying Makeup Daily

We all know how time-consuming it can be to apply makeup – especially if you want your eyeliner to look just right. With permanent eyeliner, you can kiss your morning makeup routine goodbye. Just roll out of bed and head out the door – your eyeliner will look as fabulous as ever.

No More Allergies

Permanent eyeliner is a great alternative if you have sensitive eyes or are allergic to traditional cosmetics. Because the pigment is placed under the skin, there’s no risk of irritation or allergic reaction. You’ll finally be able to enjoy beautiful, bold eyeliner without any fear of discomfort.

Maintenance-Free

Once your permanent eyeliner has been applied, there’s no need to worry about touch-ups or re-applications. The pigment is very long-lasting and will remain in place for years to come – even if you swim, sweat, or rub your eyes vigorously. 

Of course, it’s always a good idea to consult with your technician if you have any concerns about the longevity of your permanent makeup. 

Great for Busy Lifestyles and Athletes

Permanent eyeliner may be a good option if you’re always on the go. As we mentioned before, there’s no need to worry about touch-ups or re-applications – once it’s done, it’s done.

So whether you’re a busy mom or an avid athlete, you’ll be able to enjoy beautiful, effortless eyeliner day after day. 

Reduced Spending on Eye Makeups

Makeups are expensive and buying a new one every few months can really add up. But with permanent eyeliner, you can save a lot of money in the long run. Once your initial investment has been made, you’ll never have to spend money on eyeliner again – unless you want to change your style.

What to Expect When Getting Permanent Eyeliner

Before starting, your technician will use a topical cream to numb your skin. Once the area is numb, they’ll work with you to choose a style and colour for your liner. Black is always a safe choice, but some salons also offer blue, green, and even purple. Once you’ve decided on a look, the technician will map out your liner design using a pencil. This step is important because it allows you to make amendments before the tattooing begins. 

Once you’re happy with the design, the technician will begin tattooing the liner onto your skin. The whole process usually takes about an hour or two, although this will vary depending on the size and complexity of your design. 

Once the procedure is finished, your technician will perform an eye bath—this helps remove any blood or ink accumulated during the tattooing process. They’ll also give you an aftercare guide with specific instructions on how to care for your new liner. It’s important to follow these instructions carefully in order to avoid infection and ensure proper healing. 

In short, getting permanent eyeliner is a pretty straightforward process. You should be happy with your new look if you go to a reputable salon and follow all of the aftercare instructions.

Aftercare for Permanent Eyeliner

  • The first few days after your procedure are the most important when it comes to caring for your new permanent eyeliner. During this time, you’ll need to keep your eyelids as clean as possible to promote healing and avoid infection. 

  • Gently wash your eyelids with a mild cleanser and lukewarm water twice a day, being careful not to scrub too hard or get soap in your eyes. You may also want to apply a thin layer of petroleum jelly, or any suggested to keep your skin moisturized.

  • After the initial healing period, you’ll still need to take care of your eyeliner to keep it looking its best. Be sure to cleanse your face every day, including around your eye area. 

  • You should also avoid using products that contain harsh chemicals or fragrances, as these can irritate the skin around your eyes and cause premature fading of the colour. 

  • When applying makeup, be gentle and use oil-free products that won’t pull at the delicate skin around your eyes. 

FAQs on Permanent Eyeliner

How much does it cost? 

The price of permanent eyeliner will vary depending on the salon you go to, the complexity of your design, and your location. However, in Cape Town, the average cost is R2000-R3500 per session.

How Long does an eyeliner tattoo last?

Semi-permanent eyeliner can last anywhere from 3 to 5 years, though this duration is contingent on numerous external factors such as age, lifestyle and skin type. Additionally, it is recommended that individuals have a colour boost every 18 months to maintain the initial results.

Do eyeliner tattoos hurt?

The level of discomfort associated with eyeliner tattoos is often described as mild to moderate. A topical numbing cream is applied to the area before the procedure begins to minimise any pain or discomfort.

How do I prepare for my appointment?

It is important to cease the use of lash serums two weeks prior to your appointment. Should you wear lash extensions, remove them one week prior to your eyeliner appointment.
If you wear contact lenses, take your glasses/spectacles with you to wear after your eyeliner appointment.

Is permanent eyeliner safe?

When performed by a reputable technician in a sterile environment, permanent eyeliner is considered safe. However, as with any tattooing procedure, there is always a risk of infection, allergic reaction, and scarring.

Conclusion

Permanent eyeliner is a great way to save time and hassle when it comes to your daily makeup routine. Not only that, but it can also help to enhance your natural features and give you a boost of confidence. 

If you’re thinking about getting permanent eyeliner, be sure to research and find a reputable technician who can give you the desired results. And don’t forget to take care of your new liner with proper aftercare.
